annotations: Sara G. Mariam

SUMMARY OF QUALIFICATIONS
Twenty years’ experience in the Higher Ed and Banking industries
Leader in outreach and college event planning
Demonstrated ability to promote business development while reducing cost
Committed to professionalism and excellence in customer service
Train and lead team members to achieve professional goals
Recipient of certificate of excellence awards throughout Higher Ed tenure
Spearheaded a cohort undergrad program at the college with a local academy PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE
Cambridge College Cambridge, MA
Assistant Director of Undergrad Admissions January 2005 – December 2021
Provided career counseling and academic advising to new applicants and prospective students for the undergrad programs
Met and exceeded recruitment goals of matriculated students for undergrad programs
Lead numerous information sessions and workshops to recruit prospective students

Collaborated with the college’s academic, business, financial aid, and registrar’s offices to address student questions, concerns, and/or suggestions to ensure a successful experience for all students
Led and managed new undergrad student orientations three times per year
Created and implemented quarterly marketing plans through telemarketing, direct mailings, radio advertisements and print advertisements to attract prospective students
Conducted internet research to identify prospective communities & organizations for collaborations
Participated in recruitment activities including professional conferences, college fairs and open houses
Networked with organization and schools to set-up information sessions
Interviewed prospective students to determine the optimal program for them
Established and maintained relationships with outreach contacts
Conducted information session covering admissions process
Advised students with course selections and collaborate with faculty members to meet student academic goals
Successfully obtained a bachelor’s and master’s degree while working full-time Fleet Boston Financial Cambridge, MA
Branch Assistant Manager November 1999 – December 2004
Managed all aspects of branch operations
Supervised and trained diverse customer service staff to meet sales goals and provide industry-leading level of customer satisfaction
Oversaw staff development to respond to dynamic customer needs
Resolved unique customer issues
Consistently exceeded sales goals
Developed new business opportunities
Managed and oversaw payroll function and deadlines
Received recognition for sales & service aptitude in each of the last five years Senior Sales and Service Representative February 1995 – November 1999
Evaluated customer needs and identified appropriate courses of action
Responded to customer concerns
Recommended Fleet products based on comprehensive analysis of customer needs
Performed weekly and monthly audit on incoming and outgoing cash and negotiable items
Prepared the branch for annual audit to ensure the bank is following regulation and pass the audit

Cambridge College Cambridge, MA
